DataElement.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Malignant Head and Neck Neoplasm Performed Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the type of diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means on a cancer that arises in the head or neck region (in the nasal cavity, sinuses, lip, mouth, salivary glands, throat, or larynx [voice box]).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Malignant Head and Neck Neoplasm Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means on a cancer that arises in the head or neck region (in the nasal cavity, sinuses, lip, mouth, salivary glands, throat, or larynx [voice box]).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredName: Malignant Head and Neck Neoplasm Performed
Property.preferredDefinition: Cancer that arises in the head or neck region (in the nasal cavity, sinuses, lip, mouth, salivary glands, throat, or larynx [voice box]).:Performed; carried out.

Concepts.definition: A primary or metastatic malignant neoplasm affecting the head and neck.  Representative examples include oral cavity squamous cell carcinoma, laryngeal squamous cell carcinoma, and salivary gland carcinoma.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

Concepts.definition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 8/12/22 added alt VM for Alliance cjl;

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: BIOPSY ONLY
Surgical removal of a part of a lesion; some portion of the lesion is detectable on post-operative evaluation.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of a part of a lesion; some portion of the lesion is detectable on post-operative evaluation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Total tumor resection
Shunt plus partial resection
Shunt plus total resection
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgery done, details unavailable
Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An X-ray procedure using multiple coordinates to precisely determine the location of a tumor or nodule so as to obtain a tissue sample.

Concepts.definition: A biopsy procedure that uses 3-dimensional imaging to localize a lesion and guide the removal of a tissue sample.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Primary and bilateral neck dissection
Primary and unilateral neck dissection
Primary alone
No Value Exists

Concepts.definition: No Value Exists

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pylorus preserving pancreaticoduodenectomy
Surgical removal of the distal part of the pancreas.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of the distal part of the pancreas.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical excision of all or part of the pancreas and duodenum.

Concepts.definition: Surgical excision of all or part of the pancreas and duodenum.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: 3/15/22 mr Retired and replaced with 8087348, a new VM with a concept code.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgery to remove the entire pancreas. Part of the stomach, part of the small intestine, the common bile duct, gallbladder, spleen, and nearby lymph nodes also are removed.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of the entire pancreas.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of the neck and proximal body of the pancreas.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of the neck and proximal body of the pancreas.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of a lobe of an organ.: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.: The excision of part or all of a lung.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of a lobe of an organ.

One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.
The excision of part or all of a lung.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure to completely or partially remove a kidney. With a complete nephrectomy, the attached adrenal gland, perinephric fat, and regional lymph nodes are often removed as well. With a partial nephrectomy, the removed tissue contains the tumor and a rim of normal renal parenchyma only.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure to completely or partially remove a kidney. With a complete nephrectomy, the attached adrenal gland, perinephric fat, and regional lymph nodes are often removed as well. With a partial nephrectomy, the removed tissue contains the tumor and a rim of normal renal parenchyma only.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.: Surgery to remove all or part of the bladder (the organ that holds urine) or to remove a cyst (a sac or capsule in the body).

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
The surgical removal of the urinary bladder; or the surgical removal of a cyst..

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgery to remove all or part of the liver.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of all or part of the liver.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of the pancreas. (Dorland, 28th ed)

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of part or all of the pancreas.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of part or all of the stomach.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of part or all of the stomach.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of part or all of the esophagus.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of part or all of the esophagus.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of the rectum.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of the rectum.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of part or all of the colon.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of part or all of the colon.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ.: Having to do with the lungs.: The spread or migration of cancer cells from one part of the body (the organ in which it first appeared) to another. The secondary tumor contains cells that are like those in the original (primary) tumor.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.

Relating to the lungs as the intended site of administration, where the pharmaceutical product is administered, usually by inhalation, for local action in the lower respiratory tract or for systemic action after absorption via the lower respiratory tract.

The spread or migration of cancer cells from one part of the body (the organ in which it first appeared) to another. The secondary tumor contains cells that are like those in the original (primary) tumor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ.: A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.: The spread or migration of cancer cells from one part of the body (the organ in which it first appeared) to another. The secondary tumor contains cells that are like those in the original (primary) tumor.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.

A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.

The spread or migration of cancer cells from one part of the body (the organ in which it first appeared) to another. The secondary tumor contains cells that are like those in the original (primary) tumor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any of various localized therapies designed to kill cancer cells left after initial treatment.: A surgical procedure to completely or partially remove a kidney. With a complete nephrectomy, the attached adrenal gland, perinephric fat, and regional lymph nodes are often removed as well. With a partial nephrectomy, the removed tissue contains the tumor and a rim of normal renal parenchyma only.

Concepts.definition: Any of various localized therapies designed to kill cancer cells left after initial treatment.

A surgical procedure to completely or partially remove a kidney. With a complete nephrectomy, the attached adrenal gland, perinephric fat, and regional lymph nodes are often removed as well. With a partial nephrectomy, the removed tissue contains the tumor and a rim of normal renal parenchyma only.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of lymph nodes, usually done to assess the spread of cancer.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of lymph nodes, usually done to assess the spread of cancer.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast conservation treatment is defined as excision of the primary tumor and adjacent breast tissue, followed by radiation therapy.  This procedure is also referred to as lumpectomy, segmental mastectomy, or partial mastectomy. (from Consensus Statements: Treatment of Early-stage Breast Cancer, 1990)

Concepts.definition: Breast conservation treatment is defined as excision of the primary tumor and adjacent breast tissue, followed by radiation therapy.  This procedure is also referred to as lumpectomy, segmental mastectomy, or partial mastectomy. (from Consensus Statements: Treatment of Early-stage Breast Cancer, 1990)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of the breast.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of the breast.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The surgical removal of an organ or a part of an organ.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of an organ or a part of an organ.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
